TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Research

Docs.summary: Represents the controls of a Research query.

remarks.para: When working with Research queries, you must have an existing GUID that corresponds to a live data source. If the data source is unavailable or does not exist, a run-time error occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.Application Application { get; }
.property instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.Application Application
Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Application ^ Application { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Application ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: When used without an object qualifier, this property returns an object that represents the Microsoft Office Excel application. When used with an object qualifier, this property returns an Application object representing the creator of the specified object. Read-only.

remarks.para: You can use this property with an OLE Automation object to return the application of that object.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlCreator Creator { get; }
.property instance valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlCreator Creator
Public ReadOnly Property Creator As XlCreator
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlCreator Creator { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlCreator get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit Integer that indicates the application in which this object was created. Read-only.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Excel, this property returns the string XCEL, which is equivalent to the hexadecimal number 5843454C. The Creator property is designed to be used in Microsoft Excel for the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Excel has the creator code XCEL.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsResearchService (string ServiceID);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsResearchService([in]string ServiceID) runtime managed
Public Function IsResearchService (ServiceID As String) As Boolean
public: bool IsResearchService(System::String ^ ServiceID);

Docs.param: Required String an object that specifies the GUID that identifies the research service.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether the GUID specified in the ServiceID parameter corresponds to a currently configured service.

Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the parent for the specified object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public object Query (string ServiceID, object QueryString, object QueryLanguage, object UseSelection, object LaunchQuery);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Query([in]string ServiceID, [in]object QueryString, [in]object QueryLanguage, [in]object UseSelection, [in]object LaunchQuery) runtime managed
Public Function Query (ServiceID As String, Optional QueryString As Object, Optional QueryLanguage As Object, Optional UseSelection As Object, Optional LaunchQuery As Object) As Object

Docs.param: Required String Specifies a GUID that identifies the research service.
Optional Object Specifies the query string.
Optional Object Specifies the query language of the query string.
Optional BooleanTrue to use the current selection as the query string. This overrides the parameter if set. Default value is False.
Optional BooleanTrue launches the query. False displays the Research task pane scoped to search the specified research service.

Docs.param: Required Integer Specifies the language to translate from.
Required Integer Specifies the langauge to translate to.
Docs.summary: Sets the languages for the translation service.
